feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued September 01 at 3:32AM AKDT until September 01 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...The southern inner channels and southern outer coast, to include Petersburg, Wrangell, Klawock, Hydaburg, and Ketchikan. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 9:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... A series of atmospheric rivers will move across the northern half of Southeast Alaska starting early Thursday near Yakutat, and then sliding over the northern inner channels on Friday. The heavier rain is then expected to last through Saturday morning before starting to diminish Saturday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 9:37AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY... Moderate to severe drought conditions have led to very dry soil moistures and ground fuels. The combination of westerly winds gusting to 20 mph, along with low RH values, will create an enhanced risk for fire spread through this afternoon. Any fire that ignites will have the potential to rapidly spread in these
